p: On average, the number of probiotic bacteria in all three intestines as a part of the total amount of bacterial load was 22.5% and 27.2% in the control and experimental groups, respectively ( p < 0.05). In the control group, the higher prevalence had Streptococcus and Enterococcus, while the rest of the genera, including Lactobacillus and Bifidobacterium, were significantly more abundant in the intestinal content of the experimental group. The only Faecalibacterium prausnitzii was equally distributed among the groups.
